item.title: Powell's Dovish Turn: The Fallout from the 2025 Jackson Hole Meeting
item.description: At the 2025 Jackson Hole meeting, Fed Chair Jerome Powell pivoted to a dovish stance, sparking market euphoria. As expectations for a rate cut grow, three distinct characters engage in a fierce debate, weighing the optimism against the underlying risks of an economic slowdown and inflation.

item.description: Amidst persistent inflation and geopolitical risks, is ‘gold’ truly a safe haven? From attractive opportunities to fatal risks, and covering everything from the KRX Gold Market to Gold ETFs, three non-human girls will give you a clear and refreshing analysis.

item.title: Why Did Trump Call Powell 'Stupid'?
item.description: President Trump has publicly criticized Fed Chair Powell, pressuring him to cut interest rates. Mew, Kurumi, and Mikael sharply analyze the current situation, where the hope for a short-term market boost clashes with the immense risk of undermining the central bank’s independence.
